org.silex.runtime.domObject.base.GraphicDOMObjectBase

type
class
extends
org.silex.runtime.domObject.as3.DOMObject
subclasses
org.silex.runtime.domObject.as3.GraphicDOMObject
The graphic DOMObject is used as a canvas to draw bitmap graphics programmatically. It is an abstraction of Flash and JavaScript respective drawing APIs. It was at first considered to only have a drawing API in the runtime package which could have been leveraged by each of the DOMObjects, but unlike Flash where every Sprite can be used to draw graphics, in HTML graphics can only be drawn on a canvas element. As a result, drawing is only available on the graphics DOMObject as in HTML we need to make sure that the native DOM element is a canvas.

Constructor

new(?nativeReference : org.silex.runtime.nativeReference.NativeReference)

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

addChild(domObject : DOMObjectBase) : Void

overrides org.silex.runtime.domObject.as3.DOMObject

beginFill(?fillStyle : org.silex.runtime.domObject.FillStyleValue, ?lineStyle : org.silex.runtime.domObject.LineStyleValue) : Void

parameters
fillStyle the data used to draw the fill. Default to none
lineStyle the data used to draw the fill stroke/line. Default to none
Starts a fill used when drawing a shape with subsequent calls to lineTo, moveTo or curveTo. The fill remain in effect until endFill is called.

clear() : Void

Clears the current shape and line of the graphic DOMObject.

curveTo(controlX : Float, controlY : Float, x : Float, y : Float) : Void

parameters
controlX
controlY
x
y
Draws a curve from current drawing point to point x,y using the controlX,controlY as control point. The curve drawn is a quadratic bezier curve

drawEllipse(x : Int, y : Int, width : Int, height : Int) : Void

parameters
x the left point of the ellipse
y the top point of the ellipse
width the width of the ellipse
height the height of ellipse
High level method to draw an ellipse or circle. Needs to be called after beginFill or beginGradientFill was called. width and height must be equal to draw a circle.

drawImage(source : org.silex.runtime.domObject.ImageDOMObject, ?destinationPoint : org.silex.runtime.geom.Point, ?sourceRect : org.silex.runtime.geom.Rectangle) : Void

parameters
source the source image dom object containing the bitmap data
destinationPoint represent the top left point of the drawn image on the native graphic dom object. for instance a 0,0 point will draw the image in the top left corner of the graphic dom object. Takes 0,0 by default
sourceRect defines the zone from the source dom object that must be copied onto the native graphic dom object. Takes the whole image by default
Draw a bitmap extracted from an image dom object into the native graphic dom object. Alpha is conserved for transparent bitmap

drawRect(x : Int, y : Int, width : Int, height : Int, ?cornerRadiuses : org.silex.runtime.domObject.CornerRadiusData) : Void

parameters
x the left point of the rectangle
y the top point of the rectangle
width the width of the rectangle
height the height of the rectangle
cornerRadiuses the corner radiuses values of the rectangle
High level method to draw a rectangle which may have rounded corners. Needs to be called after beginFill or beginGradientFill was called.

endFill() : Void

Ends a fill started with beginFill and draw the shape and line defined by the path formed by the linetTo, moveTo and curveTo methods onto the graphical container.

inherited from org.silex.runtime.domObject.as3.DOMObject

lineTo(x : Float, y : Float) : Void

parameters
x target point x
y target point y
Draws a line from current drawing point to point to point x,y. If a linestyle is defined for this Graphic DOMObject, draw a line with the current linestyle from current point to point x,y. The current position becomes point x,y.

moveTo(x : Float, y : Float) : Void

parameters
x target point x
y target point y
Moves the current drawing point to position x,y without drawing a line.

rotate(angle : Int, ?transformationOrigin : org.silex.runtime.geom.TransformationOriginValue) : Void

inherited from org.silex.runtime.domObject.base.DOMObjectBase
parameters
angle the rotation angle, in degree
transformationOrigin the pivot point, represented as an enum value or as a point
Rotate the domObject with the given angle using the transformationOrigin as pivot point

inherited from org.silex.runtime.domObject.base.DOMObjectBase
parameters
scaleX the horizontal scale factor
scaleY the vertical scale factor
transformationOrigin the scale center, represented as an enum value or as a point
Scale the domObject with the scaleX and scaleY factor, using the transformationOrigin as scaling center

inherited from org.silex.runtime.domObject.base.DOMObjectBase

y the y offset
